name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"a719e644-253c-4e8d-bff4-7ec2e6c2b1eb","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: add_external_def","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3171186a-17f6-4788-b144-f9d54aef4be6","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_external_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is the analyzer's fallback mechanism for handling "unknown" code. When the system encounters an import that it cannot find within the project's source files (such as standard library modules like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"os","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"math","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", or third-party packages like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"requests","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it uses this function to register them as "External Definitions." This ensures the analysis doesn't break when it hits code it can't see inside of.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"94b9e8c5-479b-4eb0-9fd1-645a496d4e87","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Static analysis tools usually only "know" about the files they are scanning. If your code imports ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"numpy","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the tool doesn't scan the C-compiled code inside NumPy. However, it still needs to know that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"numpy.array","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a valid function call. This function creates a placeholder so that later, when you use ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"numpy.array","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the analyzer knows "Ah, that refers to this external thing I tracked earlier."","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"08f491f9-9cd4-4920-bf3a-ba34cabf103f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fa9dcb9c-8e9f-4a36-a03b-59bfe0fd0d25","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Create External Placeholder:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It looks for a global definition for the source name (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"requests","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). If one doesn't exist, it creates it and marks it specifically as an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"EXT_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (External Definition). This tells the system "this exists, but it's outside our project."","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3ff75328-80ed-4053-84f6-6fe83c5dbc0f","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Handle Local Alias:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the import isn't a wildcard import (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"*","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it calculates the namespace for the local name (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"req","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"import requests as req","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f368a4d8-b60e-4182-8313-3dd7a258c5c3","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Linkage:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It creates a local definition for that alias (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"req","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and "points" it to the external placeholder (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"requests","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"35ea3e62-5d60-40f2-8405-9fb4031da684","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Record Usage:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It records the line number (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") where this link happened.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"655c13be-64af-4071-9310-ea333b658132","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Consider this line of code:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fcad8040-5be3-4f1c-afe0-1430672f7f7b","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"import pandas as pd","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"06243f86-e210-4c32-bdd8-3bab68bc497a","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the analyzer is configured ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"not","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to scan the full ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pandas","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" library (which is common to save time):","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3df84119-1933-4ad1-a8d5-d25b7e161925","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It attempts to resolve ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pandas","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and fails to find a local file.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bafb9f5c-0386-4dbf-b00a-fe4c55611596","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_external_def("pandas", "pd", line_number)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"126d3049-cc63-4f36-b045-4edcc432fef3","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The function creates a global "External Definition" named ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pandas","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7d646e98-8b3e-474a-8ad8-cab931ece530","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It creates a local definition in your file named ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pd","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4d3c2b8f-23e9-4ecf-a4ae-839ff5f6f3a2","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It links ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pd","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" -> ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pandas","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"661de86a-8fc9-4ef7-9d8f-f77b2e0b816b","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Later, if you write ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"df = pd.DataFrame()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the analyzer traces ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pd","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" back to the external ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pandas","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" definition, understanding that the code relies on an external library rather than an undefined variable.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b12f2788-c12c-4b02-a6eb-7b1594133b65","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
